name: Mexico Immigration Helper
one_liner: AI guide for foreigners navigating Mexican immigration

brief.problem: Foreigners moving to Mexico face a confusing maze of immigration processes — CURP, RFC, temporary residency, FM3, bank accounts — with no good English-language resource.
brief.target_user: Expats, digital nomads, and retirees moving to Mexico
brief.proposed_solution: AI chatbot and step-by-step guides for every immigration process. Personalized based on nationality, visa type, and location.
brief.value_prop: Navigate Mexican immigration without expensive lawyers or scattered blog posts
brief.initial_revenue_model: Free tool + premium consultation upsell + affiliate (immigration lawyers)

ai_leverage.reasoning: AI handles Q&A well but core value is curated knowledge, not AI magic. ChatGPT can answer some of these questions already.

competition.reasoning: No dedicated tool exists. Just scattered blog posts and Facebook groups. Low competition.

bootstrappability.reasoning: Simple web app with chatbot. No complex infrastructure needed. Can start with static guides + AI chat overlay.

revenue_clarity.reasoning: Consultation upsell and affiliate revenue are clear but margins uncertain. SEO traffic is free but monetization per visitor may be low.

passive_potential.reasoning: SEO-driven traffic is passive. Content needs occasional updates when laws change but mostly evergreen.

team_fit.reasoning: Ben lived in Mexico for 5 years and navigated every one of these processes personally. Authentic expertise.

side_project_viability.reasoning: Very easy to build incrementally. Start with 3 guides, add more over time.

market_timing.reasoning: More Americans moving to Mexico every year. Remote work trend accelerating. Growing market.

summary: Mexico Immigration Helper leverages Bens 5 years of lived experience navigating Mexican immigration. Strong SEO potential with growing market of expats and digital nomads. Low competition — no dedicated tool exists. Easy to bootstrap and grow incrementally. Main risk is monetization — free content may be hard to convert to revenue.
